intro: Dipteracanthus hispidus, commonly known as the hairy dipteracanthus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
